skillTree.localised_description: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

A unit with the Mark of Khorne has:
	➕ Frenzy Passive Ability
	➕ Increased  Spell Resistance
	➕ Increased  Armour
	➖ Reduced  Melee Defence

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Who needs a cumbersome blade when the perfect weapon is literally at your fingertips?
Maybe it is the near-constant state of regeneration that gives the hide a toughened sheen, almost impervious to claw, talon or blade.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: His encrusted skin and warped physiology make Olg unnaturally hardy against fatigue and pain.

effects.description:
Attribute: Causes Fear
	(enemy armies in local region)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: His weapons are corroded by brine, but they bite through steel like rot through wood.
Though Olg never prayed to Khorne, the Blood God seems to answer him all the same.
The winds of the northern coast whisper plunder, and Olg listens well.
Olg leaves heaps of rusted weapons and torn armor at sea’s edge—silent tribute to unseen powers.

effects.description:
Construction time: -20% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Olg seeks forbidden knowledge from prisoners, often dragging secrets from them before their final breath.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -5
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: The Skaelings believe his vomit is the bile of Khorne himself—proof of divine fury.

effects.description:
Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for all Marauder Champion and Huscarl units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many are the dark horrors of twisted flesh and nightmares made real that the Ruinous Powers have visited upon the world, but few are quite as vicious.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Don't go anywhere near its mouth - in fact, don't even get within snapping distance if you value your limbs.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Blink and you die.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 20%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: All will listen, for the news will either be dire or wonderful.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 10
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 30

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

items.colour_text: At first glance, Brinehewer appears more like driftwood and scrap than a weapon—its haft swollen and warped by the sea, its blade mottled with rust, algae, and flaking barnacles. But in Olg Blóðsalt’s grip, the axe becomes a living extension of his cursed form. Forged long ago by a mad Skaeling blacksmith who quenched his blades in brine and blood, Brinehewer drinks deeply from every wound it inflicts. When it strikes, the corroded edge hisses, releasing bursts of caustic mist that eat away at armor and sear flesh with salt-laced agony. Legends say the axe does not merely kill—it preserves the bitterness of its victims, binding their fury into its pitted iron for the next swing. Few can stand before it twice.

The Saltmask is a corroded helm that clings to Olg Blóðsalt’s face like a second, blistered skin. Forged from bronze and iron dredged up from a sunken altar deep beneath the Kalti Delta, the mask was once a ceremonial tribute to a forgotten sea god. Now, it has fused to Olg’s features, its inner surface crusted with brine and jagged salt formations that draw blood with every breath he takes. The Saltmask reeks of damp decay and whispers with every wave, muffling Olg’s voice into a low, rasping gurgle. Yet in battle, it grants him terrifying clarity—his enemies seem sluggish and distant, like figures drowning in deep water. Some claim the mask sees for him, drawn to weakness and fear, guiding his axe toward those most ripe for ruin. Others say it hungers as he does, and that one day, it will drown him from within.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "My blade corrodes, but it never breaks—same as me."
